title: Sagittarius Monthly Horoscope
text:
Every item on this page was chosen by an ELLE editor. We may earn commission on some of the items you choose to buy.
(November 22 - December 21)
Get out and circulate with your people, Sagittarius! You’re the maestro of every ceremony, at least for the first three weeks of the month while the Sun is in Libra and your social “superconnector” eleventh house. You love playing matchmaker, whether you’re introducing two compatible colleagues or people you think would be a great romantic pairing. 
With energizer Mars also in Libra until October 12, you’re especially motivated to mix, mingle and become a member of an exciting group. Together, you can go farther faster—and with your ambitious plans, Sagittarius, it definitely takes a village to pull them off. 
Things could happen fast this month because October is eclipse season! On October 14 and 28, two change-making eclipses will light up the skies. Expect the unexpected! The first one, a solar (new moon) eclipse, lands in Libra, adding midmonth momentum to your social network. You could be offered a big opportunity to launch a digital venture, speak at a TEDx conference or join a group of thought leaders. Why NOT you, Sagittarius?
If money’s been a source of stress this spring and summer, you may rejoice when alchemical Pluto ends a five-month retrograde on October 10. The other four slow-moving outer planets (Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus and Neptune) are still retrograde for the whole month of October, giving you some extra space to step back and weigh your decisions, particularly about work, home and your living situation. Take your time to ponder those while freely exploring some new revenue opportunities.
Power down a little starting October 23, when the Sun moves into Scorpio and your twelfth house of closure, rest and healing. But don’t sink too deep into your down comforter yet. Energizer Mars is in Scorpio from October 12 to November 24, which will stoke your imagination and creativity. A bedside journal and morning free-writing sessions could yield some true gems. Be sure to capture them!
On October 28, the lunar (full moon) eclipse in Taurus brings a two-year eclipse series on your health and healing axis to a close. Your body and well-being have demanded your attention since November 2021. There’s no denying that your relationship to both the physical and spiritual planes has been transformed. If you answered the call, this could be a moment to celebrate! 
Take inventory of your habits then and now. Perhaps you went through a medical odyssey, changed your eating habits or completely revamped your routines with supplements or regular exercise. Whatever the case, you’re graduating from this eclipse period—with all of its highs and lows. Here’s to your continued good health!
But first: candy. This Halloween features a moon in your opposite sign of Gemini, which rules your partnership house. Coordinating costumes, anyone? While that’s not typically your style, you might have fun sharing some part of the celebration with a friend or plus-one. Dress up as the left and right hemisphere of the brain or pick your pop culture celebrity duo and do a spooky send-up (zombified Taylor Swift and the ghosts of her dating past?). Most important item on the agenda is that you have some well-deserved fun!
Gather with your people, Archer. The Sun is in Libra and your eleventh house of group activity until October 23, a perfect three-week period to network, entertain and collaborate. Although you’re an independent sign by nature, you need people—and now is the time to put a few key players in place to support your mission. 
With go-getter Mars also in Libra until October 12, you could be cheered and supported by members of your circle. One or two of them could shuttle your ideas onto the fast track, especially near the October 14 Libra solar eclipse. 
Mars adds excitement and stress in equal measure, and you may go into “people overload” at moments, having almost too much of a good thing. Teamwork does indeed make the dream work this month, but you need to have some literal dreams (as in, a good night’s sleep!) to keep your energy levels up. There could be a zillion events, conference calls, video chats and parties to rsvp to, so choose selectively. And be sure to log off those social media sites whenever possible, even if your posts keep going viral!
Mars is in “detriment”—a weakened position—in Libra. After all, the planet of war isn’t terribly comfortable in the sign of peace. It’s all too easy to overestimate what you can handle (a Sagittarius issue by nature). Better to underpromise and overdeliver than the reverse. Manage people’s expectations and be sure to delegate! With Mars in this team-centric zone, you could have a power posse of capable collaborators ready to pitch in. Do your part by giving them clear instructions…then letting go and trusting.
Tension over money could spike on October 8, when Mars locks into a heated square with calculating Pluto in your work and money house. 
Go-getter Mars is blazing through Libra and your eleventh house of teamwork until October 12, catalyzing your collaborations. While it could be stressful to manage a few outsized egos and personalities, you can still triumphantly bring these people together for a shared victory. 
Today, however, it could be challenging to get everyone on the same page. Fights around funding or clashing work styles can culminate in a major ego battle. You may have to step in (or pull yourself out) if things get too heated and volatile. Do you have the confidence to pull off a major project? The answer is yes—but you might need to do some internal fortifying before YOU actually believe it. 
Lean on your trusted circle and reliable team members to a point, but remember: They’re not your therapists! Reach out to a coach or trained counselor to do that inner work.
Any controlling or micromanaging tendencies start to clear up on October 10, when calculating Pluto wakes up from a five-month retrograde that began on May 1, splitting its time between two signs. Since June 11, Pluto’s been reversing through Capricorn and your second house of work and money. Whew! 
While the karmic planet reversed through this zone, it may have driven up old fears and limiting beliefs that impacted your bottom line. From power struggles with co-workers to stressful money fluctuations, conditions haven’t always been favorable for you, Sagittarius. Your confidence may have taken a few hits during this cycle. 
Now, as Pluto returns to forward motion, you can regain a sense of power and get back into the financial driver’s seat. If you’ve been unsure about whether to work with someone or take on a project, Pluto’s course correction can help you make a clear decision. 
Get ready for a spike in your popularity and influence, Sagittarius. On October 14, the year’s only Libra new moon—a boldfaced solar eclipse—beams into your eleventh house of groups and teams. Is it time to join a new crew or catapult a collaboration to greater heights? No need to work overtime because the eclipse is pouring rocket fuel in your tank.
This is the first eclipse in Libra since 2016 and the second in a two-year series on the Aries/Libra axis that will revolutionize your stardom and your team efforts between March 2023 and March 2025. You’ll learn how to navigate the spotlight as well as delegate to a capable crew. 
Sharing power is not always easy for your self-directed sign, to be honest. That’s why these eclipses are here to teach you important lessons about leadership. You don’t have to sacrifice your individuality to be part of a group, but that’s how you’ll learn when it’s time to compromise a little instead of bottle-necking progress. 
Today’s lunar mission: Start stocking your squad with people qualified to go the distance with you. This is a powerful time for networking, and, since this futuristic house rules technology, you could launch an online venture or viral piece of content. An opportunity to commune with a cutting-edge group could catapult one of your visionary ideas into the stratosphere. Team up for the win! 
With this new moon opposing wounded healer Chiron today, old pain around feeling invisible, ignored or “less than” could flare up. Your ego may need some repair work—or to head to the timeout chair. If you’re craving recognition or yearning for attention, ask yourself: Why do I want it so badly? Painful as it might be to confront the feelings of abandonment or unworthiness that lie beneath, it’s time to shed those already. What if your desire to share a message was really in service of sharing your light and spreading joy? That’s much more of a win-win, Sagittarius, motivated by creativity instead of a feeling of lack.
Power down starting October 23, when the Sun shifts into Scorpio and your twelfth house of rest and endings. For the next four weeks, the Sun’s low-lit position invites you to slip off the grid as much as possible for self-care and restorative activities. 
Shield your field if you step out into a crowd since you’re susceptible to absorbing everyone’s energy. Carry a grounding crystal, bring a wingperson and have a ready excuse if you need to depart early and get some shuteye! 
With energy planet Mars also in Scorpio from October 12 to November 24, you’ll definitely need to conserve your resources and get extra rest. You may feel both wired and tired at times. Regulate your nervous system by powering down devices an hour before bedtime, unwinding with a healing sound bath (or bubble bath!) and by nourishing yourself with lots of open calendar space. It may take you longer to bounce back after you exert a lot of energy, so if you work hard, make sure you take twice as much rest as you think you need!
Wellness check! The October 28 Taurus full moon is a partial lunar eclipse, illuminating your sixth house of health, fitness and organization. Before you tuck yourself into bed completely, the celestial spotlight beams onto your practices and habits. Are you being as efficient as you could be? Delegating instead of trying to DIY everything? 
The sixth house rules helpful people and employees. This full moon can bring a change of the guard on Team Sagittarius. You could hire, fire or meet someone who’d make a rock star assistant. Is it time for a system overhaul? From a deep decluttering to a purge of apps and subscriptions you don’t use, it’s a powerful day to clear your spaces. 
Today’s full moon is an especially big deal because it’s the grand finale of an eclipse series that’s rippled across the Taurus/Scorpio axis since November 2021, revolutionizing your health and healing sectors. Your approach to work, well-being, spirituality and self-care has been radically revamped over the past two years. 
How are your stress levels? These eclipse helped you find a middle ground between being micromanaging and being checked out. There were moments when your inner control freak got benched, and other times when you needed to snap out of denial and take action. 
Today, this dichotomy is further underscored by your ruler, expansive Jupiter, in Taurus opposing stressful Mars in Scorpio. Rather than bury your head in the sand, it’s a day to finally delegate to the capable and supportive people on Team Sagittarius. An “impossible” situation can be solved with a simple plan—but you don’t have to come up with that alone. Where there’s a will and a willing heart, there’s a way!
Changing of the guard! For the past four months, romantic Venus has been taking an extended trip through Leo and your expansive, free-spirited ninth house—the zodiac zone that Sagittarius rules. Since this is one of your favorite Venus positions, you were probably one of the signs least affected when Venus turned retrograde from July 22 to September 3.
Still, it wasn’t exactly screaming “summer lovin’ had me a blast,” Archer. Hopefully you made up for lost time over the past month, with Venus back on track and swaggering through your ninth house of travel, adventure and personal growth. (We spent a chunk of that time eating and greeting our way through Barcelona—so we hope our fellow Sags made equally good use of the transit!)
Starting October 8, things could take a turn for the serious as Venus moves into Virgo for a month. With the love goddess in your regimented tenth house of long-term goals, you may flip the switch and suddenly want to prioritize some romantic plans before the holidays. Cuffing season could get off to a better-late-than-never start for Archers looking to make things official or strengthen the relationship you’re already in.
Meanwhile, lusty Mars is powering up your social life as it revs through Libra and your collaborative eleventh house until October 12. For your free-spirited fire sign, this cycle might crank up your needs for independence and autonomy; single Archers might feel like your love life is one grand adventure. The boundary between platonic and passionate could be thin, and things could get romantic with a friend, especially near the October 14 Libra solar eclipse. One tiny word of caution: You might not have the self-restraint to think through potential consequences—but try to anyway.
On October 12, no-holds-barred Mars moves into your twelfth house of transitions until November 24, decelerating the energy. This temporary slowdown has a silver lining, though: Mars will next move into Sagittarius, cranking up the holiday heat!
Until then, you’re ready to detoxify and downsize. From hauling junk out of the basement to ousting a faux friend from your inner circle, wrap this season with a clean slate. Easy though! With brash Mars egging you on, you could act in haste. (Once you’ve donated the wedding china from your short-lived first marriage to Goodwill, it’s gonna be hard to get back.) If you must say goodbye, do it with compassion—even if you’re done for good. 
Team efforts are the fastest route to success this month, thanks to the Sun, Mars and an October 14 solar eclipse in Libra and your collaborative eleventh house. There’s no question you can go ten times as far when you join up with a supportive squad. 
Don’t be afraid to speak up and ask for what you need. With assertive Mars here until October 12, the key is being direct yet diplomatic. This will take extra finesse when working with a team. Err on the side of politeness at all times, Sag. At the October 14 eclipse, you could be invited to join an elite or avant-garde crew, perhaps one with a humanitarian twist. Membership has its privileges indeed!
But don’t forgot those humble roots—not that you ever would. The October 28 Taurus full moon, a powerful lunar eclipse, illuminates your sixth house of employees and organization. Delegate, systematize and maybe hire some help. Be sure to thank the supportive people who helps you get where you are today. If someone on Team Sagittarius is no longer a fit, this eclipse could be your cue to amicably part ways and wish each other well.

title: Scorpio Monthly Horoscope
text:
Every item on this page was chosen by an ELLE editor. We may earn commission on some of the items you choose to buy.
(October 23 - November 21)
Hang in there, Scorpio. The first three weeks of the month could be a little bumpy—but they’ll be easier if you find the courage to surrender instead of clinging to control. Resistance is futile anyhow. With two changemaking eclipses sweeping through the skies on October 14 and 28, this month will pry away anything that no longer serves you. The good news? They’ll clear a space for you to step into something even better and more genuinely suited to the person you’ve become.
Conserve your energy while the Sun is in Libra and your restful, foggy twelfth house through October 23. Energizer Mars is also in Libra until October 12, which could push you to the verge of burnout if you rush to the save and try to extinguish every little fire. You’ll pass through the eye of the needle on October 14, when a Libra solar (new moon) eclipse—the first one since 2016—brings a moment of spiritual awakening and serendipity. Allow the divine guidance to lead you instead of trying to force an outcome.
On October 10, your ruling planet Pluto will wake up from a five-month retrograde, moving forward in Capricorn and your communication zone. Have you felt ignored, undervalued or misunderstood a lot over the summer? Pick up the mic again, Scorpio. Your words will have more potency, and your genius ideas will be recognized. 
Your co-ruler Mars will amplify this Pluto power. From October 12 until November 24, the red planet will blaze through Scorpio for its biennial visit. It’s as if an inner light was turned on and suddenly the world is responding to your confidence and charisma. Ah, now that’s more like it! 
When the Sun moves into Scorpio on October 23, it will team up with Mars for the next four weeks. You might have moments where you feel outright invincible! But pace yourself just the same. We’re still waiting for four of the slow-moving outer planets—Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus and Neptune—to end their retrogrades, and that won’t start happening until next month. All of these planets are in parts of your chart related to romance and relationships. Proceed with caution before making anything official. 
There’s even more wisdom to taking it slow with your dynamic duos. Eclipses come in pairs, and the second one is on October 28 in Taurus, your opposite sign. It’s the grand finale of a Taurus/Scorpio eclipse series that began November 2021. Over the past two years, these eclipses have revolutionized your approach to both personal identity and relationships. You’ve stepped into new roles and shed connections that aren’t a fit. Now it’s graduation day!
Take a little break, Scorpio. The Sun is in savasana until October 23, journeying through Libra and your twelfth house of rest, closure and healing. Slip off the radar for the first three weeks of the month—as much as you possibly can—and prioritize activities that replenish your mental, emotional and spiritual tanks. From meditating and spending time in nature (especially near water) to dancing and listening to music: Choose your escape route and float away!
But note to Scorpios: Powering down won’t be easy with energizer Mars in Libra, disrupting this normally Zen zone until October 12. Mars is in “detriment” here, its least comfortable sign to visit. It makes sense: Mars is the warrior planet and Libra is the sign of peace. As a result, the uneasy combo can make it hard to chill out. People will be passive-aggressive, even whiny, and you might find yourself tossing and turning over stressful thoughts. 
On October 12 Mars will move into Scorpio until November 24, amping you up even more. Put in extra measures to power down at night, enforcing a strict “devices and lights off” deadline and having supportive people (whether friends, therapists or healers) lined up if you’re processing any heavy emotions or confronting some grief that you pushed aside. 
With a solar eclipse in Libra stirring up old wounds midmonth, you might as well surrender: This is your chance to heal and deal. Silver lining? By the time Scorpio season rolls around, you’ll have gotten a lot of the heavy-duty emotions out of your system!
Watch your words on October 8, when your co-rulers, penetrating Pluto and combative Mars, lock into a heated square. With Pluto in your communication sector and Mars in your twelfth house of hidden agendas, this day could crank up the gossip mill and bring passive-aggressive people out of left field. 
Evade the shade by knowing that people are likely to lure you into drama—and it’s your job to not take that bait! Be careful not to push anyone’s buttons or prey on their sensitive spots, even unintentionally. Stick to neutral topics and save the conflict-resolution efforts for another day.
Clear your throat and speak, Scorpio! On October 10, transformational and karmic Pluto wakes up from a five-month retrograde, which began May 1 in Aquarius and your fourth house of home and family. Since June 11, Pluto’s been reversing through Capricorn and your third house of expression, community and media. Messages may have gotten scrambled—or totally lost—during this retrograde. You’ve been pushed to do a LOT of thinking about how you articulate ideas and engage with others.
Communication has been an ongoing issue for you to transform and improve for the past few years as Pluto makes its lengthy, once-in-a-lifetime journey through Capricorn from 2008 to 2024. You’ve already learned HUGE lessons about how to interact impactfully with others and when to trust someone enough to forge a friendship or creative collaboration. 
Since summer, many Scorpios have struggled to get their point across—and Mercury’s recent retrograde from August 23 to September 15 didn’t help! Old fears, some driven by shame and anxiety, may have created blocks in key relationships. As Pluto corrects course, you’ll be better able to smooth out dicey dynamics. And during this psyche-probing October, you can get down to the root cause, which will help you make lasting change.
The October 14 Libra new moon—a potent solar eclipse—sweeps into your twelfth house of healing, closure and fantasy. On the positive side, this can be a beautiful moment for creativity and spirituality. It can also abruptly shut one door and catapult you through another. Eclipses can deliver swift changes that don’t leave us much time to react. Clinging onto something that’s past its prime will be futile.
Have you been holding a grudge that’s eating at YOU? This new moon eclipse invites you to commence any necessary forgiveness or amends-making process. Trade that resentment for radical acceptance. You can’t change the past, but you CAN make better choices for the future. Protect your own boundaries and let yourself be vulnerable and open again. 
This is the first eclipse in Libra since 2016, and the second in a two-year series on the Aries/Libra axis that will revolutionize your health and healing sectors between March 2023 and March 2025. 
This new moon is also opposite healer-feeler Chiron. A spiritual or artistic endeavor gets a boost from these moonbeams, and projects you begin now will blossom in the coming six months. Your efforts to release an emotional block may feel painful or laborious now, but by next spring, any hard inner work you do will also pay dividends in the form of more serenity. Take the first steps to reclaim your equilibrium.
Great news: Scorpio season shifts into gear on October 23, flipping the lights back on. After an intense and internally focused month, it’s time for some action! Pace yourself because even as your confidence and can-do spirit return, you could easily over do it. Prioritize passion projects for the next four weeks while your solo endeavors get a special hit of solar power.
With Mars blazing through Scorpio from October 12 to November 24, your powers of persuasion will be unstoppable! No more burying your head in the sand and ignoring your deepest personal desires. Put your most cherished dreams on the front burner, whether that’s starting your own business or committing to a personal goal. Do what Scorpios do best: Radar in on what you want and block out all distractions.
On October 28, the year’s only Taurus full moon, a partial lunar eclipse, will catalyze your seventh house of committed partnerships. A budding connection, either romantic or business, could turn official at lightning speed. On the other hand, a contract or collaboration might end, or it could turn in an unexpected new direction. If any relationship in your life could use some revolutionizing, this full moon eclipse is make sure that happens!
Eclipses, especially lunar ones, can abruptly turn the tides, whether you want that to happen or not. Today’s full moon is a big deal because it’s the grand finale of an eclipse series that’s rippled across the Taurus/Scorpio axis since November 2021. Your relationships AND your personal growth have both soared into new dimensions over the past couple years. And if you took the “moon medicine,” you should know thyself like never before. 
The eclipses also helped you reshuffle the balance between “me” and “we,” teaching you when you needed individuate and when it was better to partner up. With Mars in Scorpio opposing expansive Jupiter in Taurus today, you may feel the dichotomy even more acutely. Where are you giving too much at the expense of your own needs? Where might you be acting selfishly instead of collaborating and sharing power? Take one last deeply honest look at this today, Scorpio.
How about a little lightness back in your love life? That starts to happen as October rolls on, and not a moment too soon.
On October 8, Venus rounds out its extended four-month trip through Leo and your tenth house of long-term goals that began back on June 5. While there were some opportunities to get on the same page about the future, there were also a few interruptions. Venus was in a tricky retrograde cycle from July 22 until September 3, disrupting your summer flow. 
Meanwhile, Mars has been in Libra and your foggy, low-energy twelfth house since August 27, dragging its heels through this realm until October 12. On the plus side, this is the realm of fantasy, and you may have had a few sexy encounters. However, they may have come with a side of mixed messages or uncertainty, layered with angst around which direction to take. 
If you were able to find your center through the cacophony, you might have had a major breakthrough in the past month, especially since Venus turned direct. One Scorpio we know got engaged after a relatively short courtship. “When you know, you know,” he assured us.
Whatever the case, any mishaps or misgivings all start coming out in the wash starting October 8. That day, Venus moves into Virgo and your indie-spirited eleventh house until November 8. If you’re not happily hooked up, you may feel more experimental about dating, perhaps considering a long-distance or open relationship or seeing multiple people more or less simultaneously.
This is a great cycle for getting out and hanging with friends and not being so serious about love. You may be hard to pin down—if one can even find you—and attracted to people who think outside the box and aren’t afraid to pursue their grandest visions. If you’re in a relationship (or trying to be), Venus in Virgo gives you the courage to be more playfully authentic about your desires. 
But things really blast off on October 12, when red-hot Mars blazes into Scorpio, cranking up the heat, passion and your famously magnetic sex appeal. Carpe diem! This passionate planet only visits your sign every two years, and you’ll have its energizing presence at your disposal until November 24. You’ll also have plenty of momentum for a personal project, which could turn into a cult of personality with you at its epicenter. Suddenly, you’ll flip from feeling invisible and irrelevant to the hottest thing in town. Enjoy the wave of confidence and charisma, and ride it through to the holiday season! 
Conserve your energy this month, Scorpio, at least for the first two weeks. Energy planet Mars is in Libra and your twelfth house of rest and closure until October 12, alongside the Sun (here until October 23). There’s also a solar eclipse in Libra on October 14, which could finalize the loose ends of a lingering life chapter. Focus the lion’s share of your energy on wrapping up any unfinished projects and balancing that out with lots of self-care. If you can slip off for a short sabbatical (even the three-day-weekend kind), do it. 
Your motivation will return with a vengeance once Scorpio season begins on October 23. But it could ramp up even sooner as go-getter Mars starts the Scorpio soiree, visiting your sign from October 12 to November 24. Get ready: You’ll bring new meaning to the concept of finishing the year strong!
When the Taurus lunar eclipse ignites your partnership house on October 28, you could ink a deal or team up with a complementary collaborator for an even bigger win. This is a huge moment, as this supercharged full moon is also the final installment in an eclipse series that’s spent the last two-years traveling over the Taurus/Scorpio axis. It hasn’t been the easiest time, as it’s been filled with major growth and important life lessons. But you did it! You rose to the challenge and here you are. Reflect back on the person you’ve become since November 2021, Scorpio, and prepare to be amazed.

Money Days: 9, 18

title: Pisces Monthly Horoscope
text:
Every item on this page was chosen by an ELLE editor. We may earn commission on some of the items you choose to buy.
(February 19 - March 20)
A little privacy, please? For the first three weeks of the month, your introspective side takes hold, pulling you into the depths of your emotions. With the Sun in Libra and your eighth house of intimacy and investments until October 23, you have a narrow focus and could be preoccupied with people and projects that consume your attention. Intensifier Mars is also in Libra until October 12, and on October 14, eclipse season begins with a Libra solar (new moon) eclipse—the first of this month’s changemaking duo. 
Eclipses come in pairs, and the October 14 eclipse is the first one to land in Libra since 2016. It’s part of a two-year series on the Aries/Libra axis that’s revolutionizing your approach to money, self-worth and joint ventures. Your most important ties could be revolutionized, and your values and priorities might undergo big shifts. 
The second eclipse arrives on October 28, and it’s a full moon (lunar) eclipse in Taurus. This one will impact your social life and the way you express yourself. As it beams into your third house of communication, you could get long-awaited news or a surprising message. This is the grand finale of an eclipse series that began in November 2021, touching down in Taurus and Scorpio and revolutionizing communication, learning, travel and your role in the community.
Eclipses can bring sudden changes, shifting alliances and curveball news. For that reason, you might be glad that all of the slow-moving outer planets (Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus, Neptune and Pluto) are in low-power retrogrades this month. It will give you a chance to process! 
The one exception is on October 10, when transformational Pluto corrects course and turns direct (forward) in Capricorn and your eleventh house of friendship and teamwork. If power struggles have disrupted a group dynamic or your social circle’s gotten shadier than a Bridgerton scandal sheet, the drama will start to die down. 
Perspective returns starting October 23, when the Sun moves into Scorpio and your adventurous, optimistic ninth house for a month. Pull yourself out of tunnel vision and go reconnect with the wider world. Make travel plans, follow your natural curiosity about a topic, explore a business startup idea. Let your visionary side out to play now, Pisces. 
Dive into those mermaidy depths, Pisces. October always starts out as an intense and introspective time for you as the Sun makes its annual rounds through Libra and your private eighth house until October 22. You’re not exactly eager to be in the limelight now, especially with energy planet Mars also in Libra until October 12. Swim under the radar as often as you can. This is an excellent time for behind-the-scenes work, intensive research and focused tasks you can do without distraction.
The eighth house rules merging, and this solar cycle can strengthen your bonds with the innermost members of Team Pisces. You don’t have to isolate yourself or struggle alone—in fact, please DON’T do that. If you’re grappling with something complex and confounding, reach out for support from trusted people, whether friends or a professional, such as a therapist or energy worker. Real estate, long-term finances and other assets also fall under the eighth-house domain, so use this month to assess your plans and make sure you’re properly set up for the future.
From investments and shared finances to engagements and pregnancies, the Sun in this perma-linking zone has you evaluating all your closest alliances—and how far you want to go together. Libra season could spark a strong mind-body-spirit attraction to someone, so keep your antennae up for a sexy soulmate or, if you’re in a relationship, for ways to deepen your intimacy. 
Watch your temper on October 8, when a volatile square forms between Mars and powermonger Pluto, which is in Capricorn and your eleventh house of teamwork and technology. Jealousy could erupt between friends, or a simmering rivalry might reach a meltdown point. Do your best to stay out of the controversy. Attempts to mediate may backfire, so let the drama queens and divas settle their own issues without you! 
If you have to protect any legal rights or intellectual property, that’s a different story. (You’ll still need to stay out of the low-vibe conflict, though.) Call an attorney and handle your strategy on the downlow instead of getting sucked into any interpersonal scuffles. This square could also crank up some sexy tension with a friend or co-worker. Think VERY carefully before crossing that line.
On October 10, karmic powerhouse Pluto wakes up from a five-month retrograde nap, powering forward in Capricorn and your eleventh house of groups and teams. A stalled collaboration could pick up speed, and you may find group dynamics improving (hooray!), especially if tension has been simmering beneath the surface. 
Earlier this year, yous social circle may have gotten an upgrade. Associating with a more mature and ambitious crowd is paying off for you, and Pluto’s course correction could turn a few of those folks into powerful allies who can open doors. 
A mind-body-soul connection could turn into a sizzling fall romance, especially near the October 14 Libra new moon—a potent solar eclipse—which sends fresh-start signals into your intimate eighth house. The eighth house rules permanent bonds, from marriage to cohabitation to any way you might join your life with another person’s. Maybe the connection is more of a business spark, but it will ignite with equal fervor at this eclipse. 
This is the first eclipse in Libra since 2016, and the second in a two-year series on the Aries/Libra axis that will revolutionize your money, intimacy and investments zones between March 2023 and March 2025. 
The eighth house rules shared finances and investments, making this a great time to explore ways you can multiply your moolah. The solar eclipse could serve up an opportunity to join forces with a well-connected VIP. Could you merge your superpowers for mutual gain? With healer-feeler Chiron opposite the new moon, you may have to do some deeper inner work to get to the root of any blocks. 
Your perspective widens on October 23, when the Sun shifts into Scorpio and your ninth house of adventure, travel and expanded horizons. All that deep reflection of the past month will yield a refreshing wider-angle view of the world. 
You could also adopt a traveler’s mindset closer to home, looking at your current situation in a completely new and exploratory light. Perhaps you’ll sign up for a mind-expanding workshop or teach one yourself. Or maybe you’ll master that foreign language you’ve only flirted with thus far, either in a class or with an app like Duolingo. 
The actions you take are less important than your mindset: When it comes to realizing your wildest dreams, think big, Pisces. Got an idea for a business you could launch? Go-getter Mars will also join the Sun in Scorpio from October 12 until November 24, making you extra pumped to explore your entrepreneurial side. 
On October 28, the year’s only Taurus full moon is a partial lunar eclipse, igniting your third house of communication and community. An idea that’s been percolating since the corresponding Taurus new moon on May 19 could reach an exciting turning point. Have you been waiting for news or a green light on a project? It could come—and faster than you expected! 
Make sure you’re camera and microphone ready. Your opinion could be in high demand today. Record a podcast or an Instagram Reel if you’ve got the irrepressible urge to speak out. Stand up and share at the meeting. Take the plunge and be honest with friends instead of saying everything’s “fine.”
The energy is especially kinetic today because it’s the grand finale of a two-year eclipse series that’s rippled across the Taurus/Scorpio axis since November 2021. You’ve been finding your voice, speaking your truth and clarifying your message ever since. Assertive Mars (in Scorpio) is also opposite outspoken Jupiter (in Taurus) today. You might find that once you open up that can of truth serum, there’s a whole lot more in there than you expected!
Cosmic cuffing season arrives with serious intention this month! On October 8, Venus will cruise into Virgo and your seventh house of partnership until November 8. If the balance in a key connection feels off-kilter, these next three weeks provide an opening for talking it out and finding a workable compromise. 
Single Pisces should lean into your natural gift of gab for attracting someone with LTR potential. Sultry conversation is the best aphrodisiac! Don’t be surprised if a meeting of the minds quickly turns into a linking of the hearts too.
You may have some lingering tension to clear as Venus finally exits Leo and your stressful sixth house after an extended four-month visit. Since June 5, life has felt mired in the practical more than the magical—not the preferred ratio for you, Pisces. And to make matters worse, Venus was retrograde in Leo from July 22 to September 3, putting a damper on the sweet summer lovin’ you look forward to every year. 
Grrr! Use this new Venus in Virgo monthlong cycle to get back in sync with your closest people—and yourself—and to bring balance back to your bonds.
Emotions could still be intense for the first half of October, running the gamut from jealousy and obsessiveness to a passion that’s burning so strong you can’t even think about the outcome. That’s because Mars is wrapping a visit to Libra and your intense, intimate eighth house that began on August 27. With Mars in this heat zone until October 12, lust or anger can override common sense. Make sure to have plenty of healthy outlets to prevent a reactive meltdown and a messy cleanup job.
Your fun-loving side returns on October 12, when the randy red planet relocates to Scorpio and your expansive ninth house until November 24. Mars in this big-picture zone will snap you out of tunnel vision and help you see all the amorous options and adventures that await. 
Swim up to the surface, Pisces, and have a look around! With your wanderlust fired up, too many cozy days at home could make you feel claustrophobic. Poke through the travel sites and make some calls, even if the website says the place is fully booked for the holiday season. You might as well get on the waitlist. Under this spontaneous surge, hopping a last-minute flight isn’t too far out of reach. 
And if you can’t get away, bring the action and adventure close to home. With your vivid imagination, a sexy staycation should be easy to plan—whether it’s for yourself or shared with a playful plus-one. 
Invest and inspect! With the Sun in Libra until October 23 and go-getter Mars here through October 12, this is a powerful period to examine your financial and wealth-building efforts through a microscope. Libra rules your laser-focused eighth house, the realm of joint ventures, research and large lump sums. 
You’ve got the stamina for those nitty-gritty details—and you could make a compelling pitch for a shared business endeavor, especially at the October 14 Libra solar eclipse. Get things in order and you could welcome a windfall!
Exciting news could arrive with the October 28 Taurus lunar eclipse, which spotlights your communication house and attracts kindred spirits and helpful collaborators. Make your announcement, drop your new product, tell the world what you’ve been up to these past few months!

title: Aquarius Monthly Horoscope
text:
Every item on this page was chosen by an ELLE editor. We may earn commission on some of the items you choose to buy.
(January 20 - February 18)
Think big—no, bigger, Aquarius! October is your most visionary month, when your ambitions are amplified and you feel like everything’s possible for you. With two game-changing eclipses lighting up the skies on October 14 and October 28, change is happening whether you want it to or not. 
Ride the wave. These eclipses could bring an unexpected business opportunity or living situation. Buying a home, moving or a change in your family could be on the agenda at the October 28 Taurus lunar eclipse especially. That one is the grand finale of a two-year eclipse series on the Taurus/Scorpio axis that’s been making major waves in your personal AND professional endeavors. You could close out October with big decisions in both areas.
But for now, there’s a wide world to explore! The Sun is soaring through Libra and your ninth house of expansion, travel and adventure until October 23, a time when you feel like anything’s possible—and hey, why shouldn’t you? This buoyant starmap is further amped up by energizer Mars, which is making its biennial blast through Libra until October 12. 
You could give any motivational speaking guru a run for their “idea evangelist” money with this cosmic lineup, especially near the October 14 Libra new moon solar eclipse. From launching a startup to returning to school to publishing your ideas, this eclipse presses down hard on the “share” button and inspires you to put yourself out there in a big way.
Whether you realize it or not, your subconscious has been gathering a lot of wisdom and creative capital over the spring and summer. Shadowy Pluto ends a five-month retrograde on October 10 that began in your sign on May 1, then slipped back into Capricorn and your imaginative, healing twelfth house on June 11. You could emerge from this soul-searching period with many gifts to share. 
The other four slow-moving outer planets (Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus and Neptune) remain retrograde for the whole month, giving you space to ponder matters of money, home and family at a gentler pace. Don’t rush into decisions if you can help it—but know that the eclipses may force your hand despite these cosmic cycles.
Scorpio season sweeps in on October 23 and revs up your ambitious, professional tenth house. With motivator Mars energizing this career corner of your chart from October 12 to November 24, the last quarter of 2023 could be a lucrative one. Why not end the year with a success story, Aquarius? 
Halloween could be filled with tricks AND treats thanks to the moon in Gemini and your playful, passionate fifth house. Feel free to make it a spicy night for romance. But watch out for jealous vibes and masked intentions as the moon squares off against Venus in Virgo and your secretive eighth house. Maybe you’ll sneak off with a sexy costumed cutie—but screen them for skeletons in the closet and ghosting tendencies before you get swept away.
Spread your wings, Water Bearer! The Sun is blazing through Libra and your expansive ninth house until October 23, giving you a wide-angle view on life and emboldening you to take risks—creatively, emotionally and in every way. 
For your future-forward sign, who’s happiest when you have something big to look forward to, Libra season might be one of your favorite times of year. With your mind so open to new possibilities, you’ll be able to take advantage of those spontaneous moments that can lead to new friendships and adventures. Follow your curiosity, Aquarius, and see where it takes you.
Every two years, Mars arrives to ramp up your excitement to triple-exclamation-point levels—and here it is! Until October 12, the red planet will ride shotgun with el Sol, heating up your enthusiasm even more. If you can slip in a getaway, even for a weekend, this month would be ideal. You want anything but “business as usual” now, making this a stellar time to launch an indie business, sign up for a workshop or class, or to expand your mind by exploring new metaphysical ideas. Shift your perspective on the world and watch yourself attract a whole different set of results. 
One day to lay low arrives on October 8, when rash Mars locks into a volatile square with subterranean Pluto. Mars in your outspoken and expansive ninth house can tempt you to make a blunt comment or take a big risk that you haven’t totally thought through. 
With shadowy Pluto playing the blame game, you could be undermined at every turn. Someone may turn your words around on you or punish you for a misstep. You might be pointing fingers instead of taking responsibility for your actions. Catch yourself if you’re doing that, Aquarius. Where can you take the high road here instead of getting dragged into drama or defensiveness?
Come out of the fog, Aquarius. On October 10, karmic Pluto wakes up from a five-month retrograde, powering forward in Capricorn and your twelfth house of sacrifice and endings. This could be a bit like a bear rousing from hibernation—you don’t know if he’ll be grumpy and reactive or just groggy enough to seem harmless. Similarly, your own energy could be a bit erratic for the next couple days, especially with an eclipse coming.
Pluto’s been retrograde since May 1, and the first six weeks of its backspin (until June 11) it was in Aquarius—a new 20-year phase that we got a sneak preview of in March and April and where it will return to in earnest next year. Until then, you have a few loose ends to wrap up!
Since June 11, Pluto’s been back-spinning through your zone of healing and closure. Some Aquarians weathered a loss or were plunged into the depths of emotions you might not have wanted to deal with. Perhaps you did some important forgiveness work or faced up to an addictive pattern. If you’ve been forcing an outcome and swimming upstream, Pluto retrograde was a time to STOP pushing an agenda. 
The only way to free yourself from suffering is to practice radical acceptance—to the best of your human ability. That might get easier now with Pluto direct. Other important lessons from the retrograde? Allowing others to support you and for things to unfold in their own time. Now you’ll start to see that tough inner work pay off. 
Where would you like to be six months from now? And what horizon-broadening experiences do you want to have between now and then? At the October 14 Libra new moon, start putting plans into action. This new moon, which falls in your visionary and risk-taking ninth house, is also a solar eclipse—the first one we’ve seen in Libra since 2016! 
Big ideas could turn into reality quickly, so fasten your seat belt. Get some bucket-list goals on the agenda, from launching a startup venture to visiting a dream destination. The ninth house rules travel, study and entrepreneurship. Don’t limit yourself—explore all possibilities during this blue-sky month without holding back! 
This eclipse is part of a two-year series on the Aries/Libra axis that will revolutionize your zones of communication, local events and long-distance connections between March 2023 and March 2025. Influential people can enter your life from far away and right down the street in your homegrown community. Keep an open mind (and door) to all possibilities.
Got some emotional repair work to do around your confidence and using your voice? The new moon will also be opposite healer-feeler Chiron in Aries and your communication house. Reminder, Aquarius: You have something important to say, and people want (need) to hear it! Telling your own story can be transformational to someone else who’s going through a similar struggle now. Share generously—you never know who you might touch. 
Career becomes your focus starting October 23, when the Sun moves into Scorpio and your tenth house of ambition and professional goals. What would you like to accomplish over the next month, before the holidays kick into high gear? 
If excess and hedonism sent your life a bit off the rails over the past three weeks, you can corral things into more of a structure during this disciplined time. Or if you’ve had a million “ahh-mazing” ideas, you can now sort the winners from the duds and get to work on building those out. 
Go-getter Mars is blazing through Scorpio too from October 12 to November 24. You can make serious strides to the top for the rest of the year. Align yourself with power players and well-connected people or tap a mentor who can show you the ropes and save you from wasting valuable time and energy!

The annual Taurus full moon is a partial lunar eclipse, landing in your domestic and sentimental fourth house. The spotlight is on personal matters, so take a deeper look at your emotions. If you’re thinking of moving, buying or selling property or expanding your brood, this full moon could set things in motion.
Today’s full moon is an especially big deal because it’s the grand finale of an eclipse series that’s rippled across the Taurus/Scorpio axis since November 2021. For the past two years, major momentum has come to your living situation and your career. One Aquarius we know moved four times; another was promoted to an executive role, only to be recruited for an even better gig six months later! Yet another Aquarius relocated to a suburb and separated from her partner for a short term, who later moved back in on a part-time basis, and, well, they’re still figuring it all out. 
Such is life with eclipses in these important zones of your chart! You may feel the split between your work and non-work life acutely today because intense Mars in Scorpio is facing off in opposition to expansive Jupiter in Taurus. Demands are coming from all directions, and you might wish you could clone yourself several times over. 
But the goal here, Aquarius, is to feel less fragmented and more integrated. Pay attention to the signs the eclipse is sending you instead of trying to control everything with your mind. Allow the universe—and the people in your world—to support you! In order for them to do that, you have to open up a little, sink into your heart, and admit that you don’t have all the answers. Good news: None of us do, so you’ll be in good company with the other 8.1 billion people on this planet.
Partnerships: getting back on track! On October 8, Venus rounds out its extended four-month trip through Leo and your committed relationship house that began back on June 5. While that sounds like a dream for lovestruck Water Bearers, this fortunate cycle was disrupted for six whole weeks when Venus turned retrograde. From July 22 to September 3, there was static, if not constant disconnection, on the line. While things have been clearing up over the past month, you could still feel some lingering tension.
On October 8, Venus sails into Virgo and your smoldering eighth house until November 8, making for one scintillating and sexy month! Lower the blinds, queue up the slow jams. Your inner siren comes out to play as amorous Venus slips into this erotic zone. Boudoir fun and games are high on your priority list. 
Snuggling up in bed is a great place to start, so find room in your calendar for intimate connection. Do little things to get yourself in the mood. Upgrade your lingerie collection, commit to regular yoga practice, meditate each morning to shift into a state that is relaxed, receptive and ready to get close.
That might not happen until October 12, when lusty Mars moves into Scorpio (more on that in a minute). Until then, the randy red planet is burning through your freedom-loving and expansive ninth house, where it’s been since August 27. You may feel more experimental about dating, perhaps considering a long-distance or open relationship or seeing multiple people more or less simultaneously.
But starting October 12, your tune changes. Mars will move into Scorpio and your tenth house of long-term goals and serious endeavors until November 24. Now, you’ll want to know where things are headed. Where you were okay keeping things in the undefined realm, suddenly, you’ll feel the need to have clarity and direction. Keep in mind that this sudden change could give the other party in your situationship whiplash. Make sure you don’t start issuing demands and directives out of nowhere! 
For happily coupled Aquarians, the early holiday season could be an amazing time for some VIP dates and parties. RSVP “yes” and have fun dressing to impress (and express), then going out and turning heads together.
Bring on the blue-sky visions! Your ninth house of expansion, entrepreneurship and higher learning is the area of emphasis as the Sun visits Libra until October 23, joined by unstoppable Mars through October 12. The October 14 Libra solar (new moon) eclipse could set the stage for you to turn one of those dreams into reality. 
Big plans and priorities start taking shape in the second half of October. On October 12, motivator Mars blazes into Scorpio and heats up your ambitious tenth house of career and professional moves.  Until then, allow yourself to entertain possibilities far outside your usual scope.

title: Taylor Swift, Sophie Turner, Blake Lively, and Brittany Mahomes Got Dinner Together
text:
On Saturday night, Taylor Swift, Sophie Turner, Brittany Mahomes, and Blake Lively all headed to Italian restaurant Emilio's Ballato in New York City for dinner together. Swift is longtime friends with Lively and has seemingly been supporting Sophie Turner this past month as she faces divorce proceedings and a custody battle with her ex-partner, Joe Jonas.
Mahomes and Swift appear to have recently become better acquainted since the Eras Tour star attended a Kansas City Chiefs game last weekend. Mahomes is married to the Chiefs' quarterback, Patrick Mahomes, and Swift has reportedly been on a few dates with his teammate Travis Kelce. Swift's appearance at the game at Arrowhead Stadium alongside Kelce's mother cause quite a frenzy amidst Swifties and NFL fans.
For the night out in NYC, Swift wore a spaghetti strap minidress in black with a belt at the waist and a pair of strappy sandal heels. She had a black handbag on a long strap and a pendant around her neck. The Midnights singer swept her hair up into a bun with tendrils around her face and wore her signature red lipstick.
Lively went with more of a layered fall look, wearing a multi-colored pencil skirt by MOTHER. She paired it with a beige crop top and a tweed jacket over her shoulders and had on suede knee-high brown boots.
Turner arrived a bit later in a rich red-brown leather two-piece composed of a mini skirt and long sleeved jacket. She wore it with knee-high black leather boots and carried a small matching purse on a gold chain.
Mahomes wore black leather pants with a white t-shirt and an over-sized jacket made from black and gray leather with white piping, and a pair of black boots.
Swift and Mahomes became friendly at the afterparty for the game last weekend, and it's rumored Swift will attend the Kansas City Chiefs game against the New York Jets on Sunday night.

title: Florence Pugh Wears Semi-Sheer Gown With String Bikini Bodice
text:
On Saturday, Florence Pugh attended the The BoF 500 gala in a stunning black Valentino gown made from semi-sheer fabric. The dramatic skirt trailed along the red carpet in a long train while the bodice was composed of minimal fabric, forming a string bikini-style shape around her bust. 
She wore the gown with black platform heels and accessorized with a gold pendant necklace studded with diamonds, her gold septum piercing, and a few rings. The Black Widow actress had her short platinum hair slicked back away from her face with a slight finger wave. Her makeup was a natural palette with pale pink lips and a smokey eye.
Pugh loves Valentino and sultry looks that display her figure. In 2022, she wore another Valentino piece in Rome that caused some controversy because of its see-through top. She told ELLE UK that she likes clothes that show her as she is.
“I'm not trying to hide the cellulite on my thigh,” she stated. “I speak the way I do about my body because I'm not trying to hide the cellulite on my thigh or the squidge in between my arm and my boob: I would much rather lay it all out....I think the scariest thing for me are the instances where people have been upset that I've shown ‘too much’ of myself.”
She added, “When everything went down with the Valentino pink dress a year ago, my nipples were on display through a piece of fabric, and it really wound people up...It's the freedom that people are scared of; the fact I'm comfortable and happy. Keeping women down by commenting on their bodies has worked for a very long time.”
“I think we're in this swing now where lots of people are saying, ‘I don't give a sh-t,’” she continued. “Unfortunately, we've become so terrified of the human body that we can't even look at my two little cute nipples behind fabric in a way that isn't sexual...We need to keep reminding everybody that there is more than one reason for women's bodies [to exist].”

title: All About Alexander ‘A.E.’ Edwards, Cher’s Rumored Back-On Boyfriend
text:
Cher's relationship with Alexander “A.E.” Edwards seems to be heating back up. On December 25, 2022, the musical icon shared a photo on Twitter of a giant diamond ring in a pear shape being held by Edwards, displaying the jewelry box and his flame manicure design.  
“THERE R NO WORDS,” Cher wrote in the caption, adding, “ALEXANDER, A.E.”
THERE R NO WORDS,ALEXANDER,A.E pic.twitter.com/TZOYLGVWkv
It seemed like an engagement is being strongly implied here, but a few hours later, Cher posted the pic again, saying coyly that she posted it “cause his nails are so cool.”
I posted this cause his nails are so cool pic.twitter.com/aeUOOy4IIE
In May 2023, TMZ reported that the couple broke up weeks before after six months of dating and were never even engaged. Then, in mid-September 2023, they were reported to be exploring their relationship again.
Given all that history, here’s what is known about Edwards.
Edwards is the VP of A&R at Def Jam Records, and is known for his relationship with model and reality star Amber Rose. He and Rose got together in 2018, and had a son in 2019, who they named Slash Electric Alexander Edwards. They broke up in 2021.
Us Weekly reported on September 18, 2023 that they were exploring reconciliation. “They had stayed in communication even though they called things off a few months ago,” the source said. “They’ve reached a point where they want to give things a second try. They’re not officially back together yet, but they’re enjoying spending time together again and they make each other happy.” The pair was photographed out together days before, on September 15.
Then, during Paris Fashion Week, they made several appearances out together in the city. On Friday, September 28, they arrived at the Costes Hotel together in coordinated ensembles. Cher was wearing black leather over a matching satin dress. Edwards sported a black tuxedo jacket, over a white button-down, and he also had platinum locks. That same day they were photographed at the Givenchy show, again coordinated in black.
On Sunday, October 1, they were seen arriving together at the Valentino show, this time with Cher wearing her hair black.
Cher started tweeting about Edwards in November 2022, sharing heart emojis and pics of him to her fans. They were spotted holding hand in Los Angeles that same month. The 77-year-old singer and 37-year-old artist apparently met in September 2022 at Paris Fashion Week.
Alexander♥️ pic.twitter.com/o8tH1F0Th6
Cher said in a tweet that Edwards approached her. 
“He’s 36 & In End He Came after me,Till we met in the middle.He’s Consistent one ,I’m The Skittish one. We love each other…. LADIES NEVER GIVE UP,” she wrote.
Later, she discussed their relationship on The Kelly Clarkson Show, addressing the age gap.
“On paper it’s kind of ridiculous but in real life we get along great,” she said. “He’s fabulous, and I don’t give men qualities that they don’t deserve. But he’s very kind, he’s very smart. He’s very talented and he’s really funny so, and I think he’s quite handsome.”
She added, “If I hadn’t met younger men in my life I would’ve never had a date...Older men just didn’t like me all that much. ... Younger men don’t care if you’re, you know, funny or outrageous and want to do stupid things and you have a strong personality. I’m not giving up my personality for anybody.”
Sources close to the couple told TMZ on May 1, 2023 that Cher and Edwards broke up quietly weeks before. The exact reason wasn’t disclosed, but the sources revealed they were never actually engaged. Edwards had just gotten Cher a diamond ring for the holidays, and they went along with engagement speculation for fun.
The Moonstruck star was married to the late Sonny Bono from 1964 to 1975, and then to Gregg Allman from 1975 to 1979.

title: Selena Gomez and Hailey Bieber Reportedly Did Not Dine Together at Same Paris Restaurant
text:
A few days ago, Hailey Bieber and Selena Gomez were seen entering and leaving the same restaurant in Paris as the city flooded with celebrities for Fashion Week. Fans of both immediately went wild, speculating on possible interactions between the two. However, TMZ reports that while they both stopped in at L'Avenue, they did not dine together and were even on different floors of the venue. 
To add to the speculation, the model and The Only Murders In the Building star were both seen at the same fashion after-party, which was also attended by Kendall Jenner and Nicola Peltz. Once again, they reportedly did not interact.
Some of the confusion is linked to a viral TikTok insinuating a secret meet up.
Gomez is frequently linked to the Rhode founder even when they have zero contact. She was the on-again-off-again girlfriend of Justin Bieber before they ultimately split in 2018. He married Hailey shortly after. All three parties appear to have long ago moved on, but any hint of interaction or comment is picked apart by their followers as evidence of an ongoing feud.
About six months ago, Gomez's fans targeted Hailey after she posted a TikTok made with Jenner and Justine Skye, in which they're lip-syncing to the words, “I’m not saying she deserves it, but God’s timing is always right.”
The TikTok was posted around the same time Gomez was receiving unflattering attention over some paparazzi photos. Hailey has denied the post was related at all, and deleted the TikTok.
“I never comment on this type of thing but we were just having a girls' night and did a random TikTok sound for fun,” she wrote later. “It’s not directed at anyone.”
Hailey eventually asked Gomez to speak with her fans about the ongoing harassment she was receiving. 
“This isn't what I stand for. No one should have to experience hate or bullying. I've always advocated for kindness and really want this all to stop,” Gomez said on social media.
Hailey responded with gratitude, saying, “I want to thank Selena for speaking out, as her and I have been discussing the last few weeks how to move past this ongoing narrative between her and I.”

title: Kourtney Kardashian and Travis Barker's Complete Relationship Timeline
text:
Kourtney Kardashian and Travis Barker have had a very passionate and public relationship and were engaged after less than a year of dating in October 2021. They shared photos from the beach proposal in Montecito, California.
They ended up having quite a few weddings ceremonies, one in las Vegas, one in a Santa Barbara clerk's office to make things legal, and one in Italy. This might all seem fast, but they have actually been friends and neighbors for quite some time. They both have homes in Calabasas but have been in other relationships.
Kardashian has three children with her ex, Scott Disick: Mason, Penelope, and Reign. Barker has two children: Landon and Alabama, with his ex-wife Shanna Moakler, and is the step-dad to Moakler's daughter, Atiana Cecilia De La Hoya. 
In June, Kardashian and Barker announced they were expecting their first child together. 
Here's Kourtney Kardashian and Travis Barker's complete relationship timeline.
The couple was seen together in Palm Springs at Kris Jenner's home there, sparking rumors they might be dating. People reported in late January that it was official, with a source saying, “They're in Palm Springs together. They've been dating for about a month or two.” The source added, “Travis has liked her for a while.” 
E! reported they went to dinner at Matsuhisa in Los Angeles, and an eyewitness told the publication that “they seem very connected, very close. Travis took her hand, and they giggled as they started having a little thumb war with one another. It was playful and sweet. They were talking constantly and very engaged with one another. It seems like such a natural fit.”
They spent that Valentine's Day together, according to Page Six. Barker went semi-Instagram official by sharing a photo of a diamond anklet that he gave her on his Instagram Story. Kardashian shared an ode to her new boyfriend on her Instagram Story: “Roses are red / Violets are blue / Garlic bread / Blink-182,” the poem read.
She later went official-official with a picture of her hand and Barker's entwined. Barker commented “🖤” on the post. A source told People at the time,“Kourtney is very happy with Travis. She wanted to confirm their relationship, because it's something positive.”
In early March, Barker made an appearance on The Drew Barrymore Show. Barrymore asked Barker about dating with kids, and he took the opportunity to praise Kardashian.
“Up until now, I would date girls who didn't have kids, and I find it kind of hard because I think they would have trouble understanding, like, ‘Why don't you want to go to dinner every night with me? Or why don't you want to see me every night?’,” Barker said. “And now, I'm spending time with a woman who's a great mom, who's a great friend, and you don't have to worry about any of those things. It just comes natural.” 
Later in March, they were photographed at UFC 260: Miocic vs. Ngannou 2 fight, alongside friends Megan Fox and Machine Gun Kelly. 
MGK, Megan Fox, Travis Barker and Kourtney Kardashian in the house for #UFC260 🙌(@espnmma) pic.twitter.com/8kdRcCmnnP
They took their first family vacation in April, heading to Deer Valley, Utah. Kardashian shared pics featuring Alabama and Atiana on snowmobiles.
Kardashian called Barker her boyfriend for the first time in a TikTok posted by Barker's daughter, Alabama, while playing the viral “Pass the Phone” challenge. 
“I'm passing the phone to my boyfriend,” she said.
Barker also shared content from the vacation, including some videos from the slopes.
They spent that Easter together as well, and Kris Jenner shared pics of the family gathering on Instagram.
“Happy Easter, and thank you @callawaygolf #irvingazoff for making our Easter so special!!! 🙏🐰🐣🐥🙏 and thank you for the @coreygamble @realtristan13 @travisscott @travisbarker that are already on the golf course!!!!!!! LOL #impatient,” Jenner captioned the post.
That month, a source told Entertainment Tonight that things had become “way more serious.” 
“This is the happiest Kourtney has been in a while, and her family is thrilled for her,” the source said. “Kourtney and Travis' kids get along great, and all have the best time together. Kourtney's been trying to keep their relationship as private as she can on social media, but they're both super into each other and cute together.”
Then Barker got a tattoo reading “Kourtney” on his chest. 
For the reality TV star's 42nd birthday, Barker gave her a huge bouquet.
And on Instagram, he wrote, “I F-CKING LOVE YOU! 🖤 YOU'RE A BLESSING TO THIS WORLD HAPPY BIRTHDAY.”
They headed back to Utah later that month.
For Mother's Day, Barker gave Kardashian more flowers.
And he got another tattoo of the words “I love you,” in her handwriting.
Kardashian helped Barker take his first flight since 2008 after surviving a crash 13 years prior. He captioned his post about the flight to Mexico, “With you anything is possible.”
They headed to Italy to celebrate.
Shortly after, Kardashian's ex Scott Disick sent an Instagram DM to one of The Kardashian star's ex-boyfriends, Younes Bendjima, saying, “Yo is this chick ok!???? Broooo like what is this. In the middle of Italy.” 
Disick appeared to be jealous of her affection with with her new beau.
The couple went red carpet official at the 2021 MTV VMAs.
On October 17, 2021, Barker proposed to Kardashian on the beach in Montecito, California.
Kardashian and Barker spent the holidays with their family, and she shared some pics with the caption, “‘Twas the night before Christmas.”
The couple enjoyed a “practice” wedding in Las Vegas after the Grammys, and she shared photos of her and Barker at a chapel, explaining they were not actually married.
“Found these in my camera roll,” Kardashian wrote. “Once upon a time in a land far, far away (Las Vegas) at 2am, after an epic night and a little tequila, a queen and her handsome king ventured out to the only open chapel with an Elvis and got married (with no license). Practice makes perfect.”
Talk of having kids is on the table. A source speaking to Entertainment Tonight said that the couple is “so in love,” and they are “open to the idea of having children together and growing their family.” 
It was added that “their families are both supportive of it too and just want them to be happy.” 
They had another wedding ceremony in May, but this one was legally binding. TMZ broke the news that they were married on Sunday, May 15, in Santa Barbara. They left the scene of the courthouse in a convertible with a “Just Married” sign attached to its trunk.
People confirmed the news, with a source saying, “They had to legally get married first ahead of their big Italian wedding, which is happening very soon. All the details are set and the whole family, including all the kids, are very excited.”
The big ceremony took place in Portofino, Italy, and the event eventually became a special aired on Hulu. 
In June, Barker had a scary and painful health complication and had to be hospitalized for pancreatitis. TMZ wrote he was checked into West Hills hospital, then transferred by ambulance to Cedars-Sinai Medical Center.
Later, Barker wrote on Instagram Stories, “I went in for an endoscopy Monday feeling great. But After dinner, I developed excruciating pain and have been hospitalized ever since.” 
He continued, “During the endoscopy, I had a very small polyp removed right in a very sensitive area, usually handled by specialists, which unfortunately damaged a critical pancreatic drainage tube. This resulted in severe life threatening pancreatitis.”
Barker concluded, “I am so very very grateful that with intensive treatment I am currently much better.”
On Stories, Kardashian wrote, “Oh what a scary and emotional week it has been. Our health is everything and sometimes we take for granted how quickly it can change. Travis and I went in for a routine endoscopy together and he ended up with severe, life-threatening pancreatitis.”
She added, “I am so grateful to God for healing my husband, for all of your prayers for him and for us, for the overwhelming outpouring of love and support. I am so touched and appreciative.”
She then thanked doctors and nurses at Cedars Sinai for their “wonderful care” of them both, writing, “It's crazy how sometimes words could never truly express the gratitude or feelings I have inside me.” 
Kardashian joined Travis Barker as he went on tour with Machine Gun Kelly, and shared some pictures of what it looks like being a “tour wife.”
Barker commented on the post, “Tour life's better with you,” with a black heart and devil face emoji for a little emphasis. He later shared some pics of her too.
“Practice makes perfect,” he captioned it.
Which she re-shared, writing, “Time for drum practice.”
“Favorite time of the day,” Barker commented.
In September, Kardashian told WSJ magazine that she and Barker had decided to pause their fertility treatments when they were planning their wedding. 
“We started an IVF journey, but I stopped. It was a lot,” she said. “I took a break to just focus on our wedding and getting married.” 
Kardashian attended Barker's Coachella set with Blink-182 and original bandmate Tom DeLonge.
“My first @blink182 show!” Kardashian wrote on a post about the night.
Barker then commented, “Your coming on tour with me.”
In May, Kardashian shared on the first episode of The Kardashians' third season more about ending IVF. 
“We are officially done with IVF,” she said in a confessional. “We would love a baby more than anything, but I just really believe in what God has in store for us. If that’s a baby, then I believe that it will happen.”
She said added that her seven frozen eggs from before she started dating Barker “didn’t survive, [and none of them] made it to an embryo.”
“The freezing of the eggs isn’t guaranteed,” she said. “I think that that’s a misunderstanding. People do it thinking that it’s like a safety net and it’s not.” 
She added, “Whatever’s meant to be... Being happy is most important, and being a good parent to my kids.”
In June, Kardashian and Barker announced they were expecting a baby by having the POOSH founder hold  up a sign reading, “Travis, I'm pregnant” at a Blink-182 concert. 
Just one week later, they shared the baby’s sex with a shot of blue confetti: They are having a boy.
A source told Entertainment Tonight in June, “Kourtney and Travis are on cloud nine. This pregnancy is beyond Kourtney's wildest dreams. Kourtney and Travis feel like this is one of the most magical things to happen to them and a complete miracle. They are so thrilled and can't wait to experience this pregnancy together, bring a baby into the world as a unit, and expand and grow their families." 
Kardashian shared some very sexy maternity looks with the caption “lost and found.” 
In September, Barker returned from his Blink-182 tour to join Kardashian at a hospital in Los Angeles, California. The couple were photographed leaving together, but there has been no announcement as to what the issue was. However, the band tweeted about changing tour plans in light of Barker's exodus.
Due to an urgent family matter, Travis has had to return home to the States. The Glasgow, Belfast, and Dublin shows are being postponed. More information in regards to his return to Europe and rescheduled dates will be provided as soon as available.
“Due to an urgent family matter, Travis has had to return home to the States,” the band wrote. “The Glasgow, Belfast, and Dublin shows are being postponed. More information in regards to his return to Europe and rescheduled dates will be provided as soon as available.”
Barker did share images of himself in an airport prayer room as he waited to travel to the U.S. from the U.K.
His ex, Shanna Moakler did comment to TMZ that the children she shares with Barker are “safe and sound.”
“When they have to cancel shows, it's a big deal, so I am praying for his immediate family and the baby and Kourtney is safe and okay,” she added.
At the end of September, Barker and Kardashian celebrate their son’s upcoming arrival with a Disney-themed baby shower. 
Fans speculated that Barker may have hinted that they plan to name their baby Rocky, as he liked a post on X, formerly known as Twitter, calling the name out as cute.
On Saturday, September 30, Kardashian shared a photo in her Instagram Story of a gorgeous rose bouquet sent to her by Barker after he returned to his tour with Blink-182. According to his Stories, Barker had touched down in Lisbon, Portugal.
On October 1, Kourtney shared some shots of one of her Halloween costumes as the “Bride of Frankenstein.”
In her Stories, she reposted a Reel from when she and Barker dressed up as the Bride and Frankenstein's Monster.

title: Heidi Klum Reportedly Wants Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce at Her Famous Annual Halloween Bash
text:
Model Heidi Klum is famous for her Halloween costume parties, and she is already considering her guest list. At the top of it are Eras Tour star Taylor Swift and her new romantic interest, NFL star Travis Kelce. In a conversation with the Daily Mail, Klum essentially offered an open invitation to the pair. 
“I would love to invite them,” she said at the American's Got Talent show finale, which Klum judges.
She added, “If they would just show up, I'm sure no one at the door will turn them away. Unless the costume is so strong that no one recognizes them, like mine.”
Klum could have been referring to a number of elaborate costumes she's donned over her many years as a Halloween hostess, but she most likely meant her “earthworm” costume from 2022. She was definitely unrecognizable.
The costume went immediately viral and Klum was applauded for her sense of humor, but she said her team told her it was a “crazy” idea and tried to discourage it. Thankfully, she could not be stopped.
Swift and Kelce were seen together last weekend following the Kansas City Chiefs game at an after party, where photographers snapped a shot of her with an arm around his neck. She was also photographed in the VIP box with Kelce's mother, Donna.
It has been rumored that the pair have just started spending time together, but a source said they have already been joking about a couple's costume. Specifically, they want to go as Barbie and Ken from the Margot Robbie-led hit. 
“The whirlwind that this relationship has started is something that Taylor is familiar with, and Travis is OK with,” the insider said. “He wants to get in as much time as possible with her before she embarks on her international tour.”
They add, “Heidi Klum's Halloween party is a very big option for them to attend, they haven't made it 100 per cent, but since they have made things official in other ways that they have even started a relationship, they are really feeling it all out and they might want to make that night be the night they go, red carpet official.”
The new couple is entirely aware of how much scrutiny they're already receiving.
“This is the relationship they put themselves into, and they are prepared to see it through and see where it goes and are looking to take advantage of everything it brings on the outside along with the personal enjoyment that comes from it,” the source explained.
